name: relevantly

in a way that is connected with what is happening or being discussed: She spoke very knowledgeably and relevantly about the subject. It's a long way to get there and, more relevantly, there are no buses running at that time of night.
More examplesFewer examplesCredit for this achievement must go to the management team of the club and, most relevantly, to the head coach.Relevantly for our purposes, information about the history of the site can be found in the local museum.If you are going to quote Shakespeare, at least try and do it relevantly.
